tweets.text:
@tellenby @JoeWStanley @NFUEastMidlands @clamidlands @EnvAgency @NWLEnviro @CoalvillePolice @ABridgen @DefraGovUK I will never understand the mindset of someone who thinks chucking their rubbish anywhere they like is ok, whatever their feeling of entitlement.

Perhaps it is only the minority, but more access to the rural parts of our nation must come with increased responsibility.

tweets.text: @JoeWStanley @farmer_richiet @NFUEastMidlands @clamidlands @EnvAgency @NWLEnviro @CoalvillePolice @ABridgen @DefraGovUK I think this feeling is more common than we imagine. COVID19 Summer has thrown it up repeatedly. People abusing countryside because they have a sense of ownership. We can do what we like -it's ours, we own it.

Great to be collaborating with our @HeritageFundNOR, @HistoricEngland & @EnvAgency colleagues to help the @The_NP11 and the #North to #LevelUp #Culture and the #Arts. We are all #HereForCulture https://t.co/wfrQz8BrK4

We're proud to announce a partnership with the @EnvAgency to deliver some of our groundbreaking flooding courses, including:

üö∏ Supporting Children & Young People after Flooding 
üåä The Flood Recovery Process 

Find out more here: https://t.co/KRGIk3ARET #Environment #Flooding https://t.co/ADah1hO2zm

The other issue is the council left acrows in the #RiverWandle well beyond the @EnvAgency permit "Temporary scaffolding in a main river for no more than 4 weeks".

Email¬†democratic.services@merton.gov.uk¬†stating the reasons why you think the discussion should be held in public. https://t.co/X90TOHzslD

New coastal emergency 999 stickers have been launched along the Redcar & Cleveland coastline in partnership with @EnvAgency @CoastguardNE @RedcarCleveland      - the safety slogan inc. ‚ÄòNo #selfie is worth your life‚Äô. For the full story https://t.co/V4B0DthDHs #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Uk8lOyvW4e

tweets.text: @tellenby @farmer_richiet @NFUEastMidlands @clamidlands @EnvAgency @NWLEnviro @CoalvillePolice @ABridgen @DefraGovUK Wow.

Every single day sees new piles of garbage dumped in the lanes & gateways around my small farm on the urban fringe.

Humanity has a real problem. https://t.co/Fcqt6UwFZM

Our next priority for investment is #culture, #leisure and #tourism. 

Recognising that each area faces challenges, the #North will build upon its diverse heritage and natural asssets, level-up the visitor economy and lead a coordinated approach to recovery. #NorthTogether https://t.co/9EyGFgCZGN

@ThanetCouncil @filthythanet @EnvAgencySE Thank you. I shouldn‚Äôt have to keep reporting missed bins. The surrounding properties were all done. And there was nothing blocking the road or access to the bin store.

They block sewage pipes and can harm our wildlife. 

#WorldWaterWeek https://t.co/OjlTSjd4aF

tweets.text: @Dryad711 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @pow_rebecca @Dryad711 Hello, we don't allow illegal activity on our land, and if there is clear evidence of illegal activity, this should be reported to the police.
@JamieDixon72 @EnvAgencyNW üëèüëè it‚Äôs time for the ‚Äòsilent infrastructure‚Äô to shout a bit louder!!
@EnvAgency  guy: "They're 'Poor' status in the River Basin Management Plan. That's a fact. We can't deny that. The cost of addressing that has been deemed disproportionately too high as it is."
@EnvAgency guy: "We know that all of these ground water bodies for the west of our area (EAnglia) are failing presently to meet their environmental objectives."
@EnvAgency guy: "We know that most of our ground water bodies are over-licensed, over-abstracted."

@buttery_simon @EnvAgency @GroundControlGC Some great shots there Simon. @GrahamBirdGC nice to see you finding your feet.

Augmentation at Ivel Springs is therefore essential, but not at feeble 0.4 ML rate proposed by @AffinityWater - which is less even than the Q90 figure calculated by @EnvAgency. The new borehole must have capacity to augment at 5 ML.
@EnvAgency talk of cost-benefit analysis and say reducing over-abstraction is too expensive. Only a token cap on abstraction at Baldock will be applied.

Just been speaking about #flood #preparedness in #Cumbria since 2015 @EnvAgencyNW @CumbriaCC have worked to better protect 3400 with over 1200 more to come before winter.  Photo below is the last concrete being poured for the #Rickerby scheme https://t.co/iuD6OSpGxm

There's a lot of surface water around today following the heavy rainfall üå®Ô∏è. 

Please be careful when out and about today and never drive through flood water - just one eggcup of water can wreck your engine. 

#preprareactsurvive #beprepared https://t.co/QKRUG8HrMX

#TeamEA have been cleaning grids at Preesall Pumping Station today to make sure our rivers are clear of debris washed down by the heavy rain. 

We regularly monitor our regions rivers and work around the clock to keep them clear. https://t.co/fDVI7Tu1jO

A big surge in rivers being adopted by pressure groups. If you know of an orphaned river take it under your wings. The good people at @AquiferChalk are creating a tool kit for you. We need more of you because the @EnvAgency under current senior management are useless.
